name: NSLineBreakMode
desc: Constants that specify what happens when a line is too long for a container.

items.name: case byWordWrapping
items.desc: The value that indicates wrapping occurs at word boundaries, unless the word doesn’t fit on a single line.

items.name: case byCharWrapping
items.desc: The value that indicates wrapping occurs before the first character that doesn’t fit.

items.name: case byClipping
items.desc: The value that indicates lines don’t extend past the edge of the text container.

items.name: case byTruncatingHead
items.desc: The value that indicates that a line displays so that the end fits in the container and an ellipsis glyph indicates the missing text at the beginning of the line.

items.name: case byTruncatingTail
items.desc: The value that indicates a line displays so that the beginning fits in the container and an ellipsis glyph indicates the missing text at the end of the line.

items.name: case byTruncatingMiddle
items.desc: The value that indicates that a line displays so that the beginning and end fit in the container and an ellipsis glyph indicates the missing text in the middle.
